pullrequest.title: LED plugin and color blocks to FlashLight Plugin

content.raw:
This changes the ABI of `FlashLightPlugin` by adding virtual functions

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/658/API_5fABI_20report/

that is ok if we merge this before making another gazebo9 release, since `FlashLightPlugin` has not yet been released
content.html:
This changes the ABI of FlashLightPlugin by adding virtual functions

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/658/API_5fABI_20report/

that is ok if we merge this before making another gazebo9 release, since FlashLightPlugin has not yet been released

pullrequest.title: LED plugin and color blocks to FlashLight Plugin

content.raw: When LedPlugin is used, it would need to have moth <visual> and <light> elements if FlashLightPlugin checks the <light> element. I just thought it would be useful if a link is allowed to have only <visual> without <light>. But, it may be a weird feature and may violate inheritance concepts. What do you think?
content.html: When LedPlugin is used, it would need to have moth <visual> and <light> elements if FlashLightPlugin checks the <light> element. I just thought it would be useful if a link is allowed to have only <visual> without <light>. But, it may be a weird feature and may violate inheritance concepts. What do you think?

pullrequest.title: LED plugin and color blocks to FlashLight Plugin

content.raw: I was just thinking that calling `GetElement` will *create* the sdf element if it doesn’t exist. So the concern is that you may get an element with default values that doesn’t correspond to any lights defined in the link
content.html: I was just thinking that calling GetElement will create the sdf element if it doesn’t exist. So the concern is that you may get an element with default values that doesn’t correspond to any lights defined in the link

pullrequest.title: LED plugin and color blocks to FlashLight Plugin

content.raw:
Oh, I misunderstood your question. Sorry!

I think I have picked old code when I merged this branch with the original branch by meld. It now calls `HasElement` to check them. Thank you for pointing this out.
content.html:
Oh, I misunderstood your question. Sorry!

I think I have picked old code when I merged this branch with the original branch by meld. It now calls HasElement to check them. Thank you for pointing this out.

content.raw: minor style suggestion. We've been trying to remove the `Get` Prefix and use `Count` in place of `Num` in gazebo. So to keep consistency, this could be named as `BlockCount`
